lunar_events.description: A total lunar eclipse visible in North and South America, Europe, and parts of Africa and western Asia.
A partial lunar eclipse visible from parts of North America, Europe, and parts of Asia.

solar_events.description: An annular solar eclipse visible in parts of the Pacific Ocean, Chile, and Argentina.
A partial solar eclipse visible from parts of the Arctic, Europe, and northeastern North America.

meteor_showers.description: One of the most famous meteor showers, visible from the Northern Hemisphere.
A major meteor shower visible from both hemispheres.

planetary_alignments.description: Jupiter and Saturn will appear close together in the sky.
Venus and Jupiter will appear close together in the sky in the early morning.

comet_appearances.description: Expected to reach perihelion in 2025, may offer a good show depending on its activity.
Expected to be visible in 2025, with brightness depending on its activity.

supermoons.description: A supermoon, making the Moon appear larger and brighter than usual.
A supermoon, making the Moon appear larger and brighter than usual.
A supermoon, making the Moon appear larger and brighter than usual.

equinoxes_and_solstices.description: The start of spring in the Northern Hemisphere and autumn in the Southern Hemisphere.
The start of summer in the Northern Hemisphere and winter in the Southern Hemisphere.
The start of autumn in the Northern Hemisphere and spring in the Southern Hemisphere.
The start of winter in the Northern Hemisphere and summer in the Southern Hemisphere.

planetary_events.description: Mars will be directly opposite the Sun, appearing bright and large in the sky.
Mercury will transit across the face of the Sun, visible from different regions of Earth.

star_clusters_and_nebulae.description: A planetary nebula located in the constellation Draco, observable through small telescopes.
The Great Hercules Cluster, a dense and bright star cluster visible in the summer skies.

other_conjunctions.description: Mercury and Venus will appear close together in the sky during the early morning.
Mars and Venus will align in the sky, creating a beautiful celestial sight.

asteroid_approaches.description: Asteroid 1998 OR2 will pass close to Earth, though at a safe distance, offering an interesting observation target.
